review:
overall, i liked this movie but also understand why some people thought it was laughably bad. 

i laughed too, a couple of times during the first 1/3 of the film, it's so overwrought. the director and cinematographer try too hard to make it visually interesting -- the editing is frenetic and not in a good way. also can't stand when characters narrate obvious things aloud to the audience, things they would clearly only think to themselves if they were literary characters and not cinematic characters; for example, yelling into the steering wheel, "no, that's the wrong minivan!" 

maybe this is a pet peeve of mine because i write, but if you absolutely need dialogue like this, why not just introduce it in voiceover as thoughts? film is a visual medium, yes, but if that's the argument, why not take the superfluous dialogue out altogether and let the performer's face carry the emotion? halle berry is a strong enough actress to have accomplished such a feat.

in fact, as the story progressed, i felt more and more for her character, which i chalk up to her talents, not the script. i'm not a parent but still managed to appreciate her performance and the ferocious dedication she embodies. mothers are no joke, man (fathers too, of course, but this is a story about an average single mom).

having been raised by a single mother myself, i've seen firsthand the strength they can tap into, the decisions and actions they're capable of in order to protect their children, and i saw my mom in this character. actually, i'm willing to bet that's why some -- including myself -- are so forgiving of this movie because, in truth, it is not well made or particularly well written (the simple premise is fine, but we don't even get the kidnappers' motivation until the last 20 minutes). 

still, it's got a bit of power behind it. you can see what they're going for, and if you're a halle berry fan, you might be able to find enough of the filmmakers' good intentions to get behind them in the end...though the end has some holes and things thrown in -- and then neglected even -- as well.

presentation? 3/10. heart? 6/10

i do think good mothers and people who have good mothers will like this movie.

a fantastic movie.. not sure why it's rated 5.9 on imdb. 
brilliant performance in each n every scene by halle. very natural n thorough acting by her. 
the direction was gripping and no nonsense. the story was simple but great execution, not many directors could it pull it up like this.
there were many intelligent shots where it appeared that some common sense bits were not captured but after the scene you realize that it was actually captured in a subtle way, hence common sense n a natural execution.
i would give it 8.5/10

why bad ratings? this was not a horrible movie by any means. i think people are reading way too much into this movie. some of the reviews i've read are written by incredibly picky individuals who probably don't get impressed by much at all.

anyways, i loved it. this movie kept my attention until the very end. i was literally biting my fingernails. 

this mother never gave up. the ending was not predictable as usual in these type of movies, the parents don't get to follow the kidnapper...or even stay on him... this was from the parent's point of view and not the child. loved it. 


usually, the kidnapper is long gone. this was a different type of kidnap movie and i enjoyed it very much. however, i wish the father would have been included and that the ending wasn't so quick to be done. 

i wish the director/writer would have shown the two girls being reunited with their parents and whether or not franky's mom won custody of her son over her ex-husband. that would have made a great ending!  i'd rate this a 8/10.

this movie is good if you're going to watch it. i don't understand why or what factors people use to give reviews and judge movies nowadays.
in my opinion, it was thrilling, very suspenseful and i think halle berry did a fine job of helping the audience understand the emotions of a mother that just lost her child and how far this mother's willing to go.

sure, there might be little things that are questionable but it's the same as any other movie with scenes that could have gone one way but went another.

"kidnap" delivers more laughter than thrills.

the unintentional comedy mostly comes from the terrible camera work and that horrible rap song at the end. i couldn't believe what i was hearing.

but i'm glad an oscar winner like halle berry is in "kingsman: the golden circle" next. i mean, it's not going to save her whole career, but at least it's an actual movie and no "kidnap" or "catwomen". it's been awhile since she's been in anything that's worth calling "good".

worst movie i've ever watched. let me elaborate: half of the movie is a badly shot car hunt. you don't understand what the motifs behind the kidnap is. then it's also super unrealistic the womans car gets hit about 500 times and it's still going but no that's not the best part, best part is the women survives 5 car crashes, a woman trying to choke her, a man with a gun (she does not have any weapons). so don't waste your time btw couldn't finish it it was so bad and people writing good reviews are probably trolling cuz i can't believe somebody would actually like it.

as a mom i was yelling at my tv so men....dont want it with people like me haha. it was great but there's the "are you kidding me!" "what are you doing!" "speed uppp!" moments. 

very heart warming movie my two year old baby girl is sleeping with me tonight for sure. 
id give it a 8/10
i don't usually like movies i'm not a sit still and watch something all the way thru type.

i absolutely love this movie. its shows that a mothers love has no boundaries and she is willing to do whatever it takes to get her child back. its gripping and keeps me on the edge of my seat. ms. berry did an amazing job.

still not sure if i liked it or not.  it was griping but i got really irritated with halle berry.  she was continually screaming.  i'd be shouting and saying a few choice words.  i aiso found the start a bit drawn out and really has anyone seen a waitress come off shift looking neat and tidy and spritely, then climb into a brand new suv? yes it does explain that she is going through a divorce but that is also a bit irrelevant to the movie and the plot

the film was fine for what it was.  same as quite a few other films.  
the music at the end made me burst out laughing it was so bad.  i think the song is called relentless.  the film's pretty relentless itself.  there's no rest from the minute the kid gets... napped.
keeps you watching though, partly just to see if you can glimpse around halle berry's make-up.  she looks about 20 years younger than she is...

i think haley berry was superbly amazing in portraying the character of karla. the innate desire to rescue and protect her son was no match for his abductors. amazing movie.

what i see from this movie is a persistent mother with strong will to save her own child. resilience is the key factor that the movie tells. what this mother did is quite natural as a mother in general. if you hear about a story a few months ago about a mother from british columbia of canada saved her son bravely from the bloody mouth of two cougars one afternoon from her own backyard, you will not be surprised by the mother‚Äôs action anymore. i love this movie.

then she just had to run out of gas while in pursuit. and then she wastes time explaining to people about why she wants them to call the police.

i thought this movie was awful.  it was so frustrating. who leaves their son alone in a crowded park, drops their phone doesn't run the guy over when she has the chance doesn't trade money for her son just throws the wallet at him...she did get smarter as the movie went on but her inability to communicate to people that her son had been kidnapped was frustrating.

it is riveting!!! when she said 100k i immediately thought of the father must have set this up and i was pissed just at the prospect...the revenge was very  satisfying. i.loved. every. delicious. nanosecond.
